Title: Female Perversions
Writer: Louise J. Kaplan (book), Julie Hébert (screenplay), Susan Streitfeld (screenplay)
Actors: Tilda Swinton, Amy Madigan, Karen Sillas, Frances Fisher
Plot: Dresses, lipsticks, sex - the "perversions" (and neuroses) of Eve, a young, very successful lawyer. Her days are a tightrope act between extreme eloquence and frosty toughness on the one side, and scaring vulnerability on the other. The climax of her career shall be the possibly forthcoming appointment as a judge, but this step seems to be interrupted by her kleptomaniac sister Mad who is arrested after one of her raids. Eve travels to Mad's town to stand by her in the jail. Their struggle about Mad's illness evokes suppressed conflicts. Eve stays at her sister's flat where she meets a girl who fights with her budding femininity.
